docs.text: " it was not scary . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these are the first words that came to mind after it was over .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when a movie is called _vampires_ , " not scary " aren't words that should be associated with it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but that wasn't my only gripe .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: john carpenter is a name associated with cutting-edge cinema , as in the intense scares of _halloween_ , _the thing_ and _the prince of darkness_ , or the offbeat action of _they live_ and _escape from new york_ .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , the only thing that is cutting edge about _vampires_ is the level of boredom the movie is able to reach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with an anemic plot and not-quite-kosher special effects , _john carpenter's vampires_ has barely enough substance to slake the thirst of even the least discerning genre fan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is at first concerned with a group of roaming vampire slayers , led by james woods , of all people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like some sort of holy a-team ( they even have their own souped-up van ) , the bunch invade and wipe out a nest of vampires in a new mexico shack .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their method is amusingly innovative : the blood-suckers are reeled out with harpoons so they can flare up in the sun like matchsticks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to commemorate their victory , the loutish band decorates a motel room with hookers and parties the night away .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their celebration is short-lived , however , as a master vampire named valek ambushes and single-handedly destroys most of the team .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woods' jack crow and buddy montoya ( daniel baldwin ) escape with their lives , along with a woman named katrina ( sheryl lee ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although the woman has been bitten , montoya and crow decide to keep katrina for her psychic link to the master vampire .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the rest of the movie is concerned with the boys' hunt for valek ( thomas ian griffith ) , a freaky marilyn manson-type who's on a mission that dates back 600 years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way they pick up a priest named guiteau ( tim guinee ) , a character who serves pretty much the same purpose as the jittery cpl .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: upham in _saving private ryan_ .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some stuff happens in the middle of the movie , but i can't remember most of it , because i often found a twitching hair in the corner of the frame more interesting than what was happening on screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: _vampires_ finally starts to pick up about 90 minutes into the mix , as crow , guiteau , and montoya assault an abandoned prison-turned vampire nest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only then does the film begin to even resemble a carpenter flick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it's too little too late .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we get the inevitable final confrontation , but it seems tacked on and rather anti-climactic ( come on , we're dealing with _the_ master vampire here ! )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: interestingly , last summer's vampire actioner _blade_ was derived from a comic book , and _vampires_ from a novel , yet the latter seems more steeped in campy cheesiness than the former , a more deliberate superhero flick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woods' jack crow spouts glib off-the-cuff one-liners and strolls away from exploding buildings with that oh-so-cool stride .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and his motive for killing vampires ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: take a wild guess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( hint : a ______ killed his _____ when he was just a _____ . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at least _blade_ had decent action and slick stylishness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: _vampires_ lacks even cheap thrills to mask its gossamer-thin plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to make up for this , the movie resorts to other " shocks , " such as its generally condescending attitude towards women ( crow slaps them around for the fun of it ) and an overplayed contempt for religion ( crow teases guiteau incessantly about whether his vow of celibacy has made him prone to " getting woodies . " )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it can be argued that maybe i wanted too much from this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if not scary and gory , i wanted tense , relentless , and exhausting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: _john carpenter's vampires_ is none of these .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i can only recommended it for the hardcore carpenter fan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for the rest of you looking for a good scare , beware : _vampires_ is a film with no teeth .
docs.label: negative
